title: THRONIA
content:
THRONIA was the Naid-nymph of the spring, well or fountain of the town of Abdera in Bistonia, Thrake (north of
        Greece). She was loved by the god Poseidon and bore him Abderos (Abderus), the eponymous founding-king of the
        town.

Abdera, however, was usually said to have been named by Herakles after his squire Abderos who was torn apart by
        the man-eating mares of Diomedes.

Pindar, Paean 2 (trans. Sandys) (Greek lyric C5th B.C.) :
        "Abderos, with breast-plate of bronze, thou son of the Naias Thronia and of Poseidon."
